Atacama Desert: the driest (non-polar) desert on Earth

I think the pilots that fly the route between Santiago and Calama, the airport to access the Atacama Desert, must be exceptional. It’s a short flight but it flies over some unreal and unforgiving landscapes that are created by the unique conditions of two mountain ranges creating a double rain shadow effect. O trek in Torres del Paine

For 8 days from the end of February to the beginning of March, we hiked the “Circuito O” in Torres del Paine, a ~110 kilometer route that runs through the backside of Torres del Paine and finishes with the iconic view of the Torres.
